title: Andhra Pradesh HRD Minister Lokesh lays stone for Reliance Industries Limited’s CBG plant at Divakarapuram in Prakasam district
content: The 100-tonne capacity state-of-the-art plant spread over 475 acres is being established with an investment of ₹139 crore; RIL is investing a total of ₹65,000 crore to establish 500 CBG plants across the State, which are expected to generate employment opportunities to approximately 2.5 lakh people

title: Kerala State Electricity Board eyeing collaboration with IIT-Bombay for pilot project in vehicle-to-grid technology
content: V2G systems allow EV batteries to not only draw power from the grid, but also return it to the grid during periods of high electricity demand, thereby serving as decentralised energy storage systems

title: Indian national sentenced to 9 months in jail for molesting cabin crew on Singapore Airlines flight
content: Balasubramanian Ramesh molested the four women over a period of 14 hours during the San Francisco to Singapore flight

title: Ithikkara block panchayat sets up library affiliated to library council
content: Cultural-Agricultural Museum and Library has over 3,000 books, newspapers and over 20 weekly and monthly magazines

title: Waqf Amendment Bill a conspiracy to oppress the minorities, says APCC chief
content: The motive is to encroach the properties and hand them over to Prime Minister Modi’s associates and proxies, Sharmila alleges in a post on X

title: Puducherry history-sheeter ‘Mottai’ Vijay shot dead by police near Cuddalore
content: The police said they were forced to open fire after the accused allegedly attacked two policemen with a machete as he was hiding in a cashew orchard at M. Pudur

title: Swadesh Darshan 2.0: Alappuzha to get major tourism boost with ₹93.17-crore project
content: ₹37-crore canal side transformation aims at restoring and revitalising the historic canals of Alappuzha town. Project is expected to be completed by March 31, 2026

title: How to get e-pass to visit Nilgiris and Kodaikanal?
content: To restrict the number of vehicles entering the Nilgiris and Kodaikanal during the peak tourist season between April and June, e-passes are being issued to limited number of vehicles registered outside the two hill stations

title: What are the key changes proposed in the new Waqf Bill? | Explained
content: The revised Bill incorporates contentious amendments based on the recommendations of a Joint Parliamentary Committee

title: Court junks Medha Patkar's plea against conviction in Delhi L-G's defamation case
content: Delhi court dismisses Medha Patkar’s plea, upholds conviction in defamation case against V.K. Saxena after 23 years

title: Gujarat firecracker blast: Forensic probe found aluminium powder caused explosion, say Police
content: Apart from aluminium powder, a team from the forensic science laboratory (FSL) also found yellow dextrin powder from the warehouse

title: Karnataka government issues order to prepare power evacuation scheme for Sharavati pumped storage project
content: Senior official in Energy Department says, ‘We will only set up what is practically feasible in the region. We will follow the guidelines issued by the Forest Department and the Wildlife Board’

title: Government appoints Poonam Gupta as the next RBI Deputy Governor
content: Poonam Gupta appointed as RBI Deputy Governor for three years, with extensive experience in economics and academia

title: Akhilesh Yadav mocks over delay in electing President; Amit Shah hits back with dynastic politics dig
content: Home Minister said that the BJP is not a dynastic party and thus, it takes time to decide on its leadership, unlike parties where succession is “predetermined”

title: India's media ecosystem doesn't need validation from foreign bodies: Centre
content: India was ranked below Turkiye, Pakistan and Sri Lanka on the Global Press Freedom Index, which stood at 158th, 152nd, and 150th positions, respectively

title: Governance in democracy can only be by executive, not courts: Rajya Sabha Chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar
content: Jagdeep Dhankhar made the remarks during Question Hour after Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan referred to Supreme Court directions while replying to DMK member Kanimozhi NVN Somu's demand for decentralising NEET

title: MNS to oppose release of ‘Abir Gulaal’ film for featuring Pakistan actor Fawad Khan
content: MNS, vowing to block ‘Abir Gulaal’ in Maharashtra, opposes release of the film featuring Pakistani actor Fawad Khan

title: Ready for peace talks if Centre stops ‘Operation Kagar’, says CPI (Maoist) Central Committee
content: The CPI(Maoist) says over 400 people, including Adivasis, have been killed by security forces in the name of ‘Operation Kagar’

title: India, Nepal ink 10 MoUs worth Nepalese Rs.625 million for community development projects
content: “The agreements were signed on April 1, 2025 for development in the education-, health- and cultural sectors,” the Indian embassy in Kathmandu said

title: Disability associations urge T.N. govt. to hike monthly allowance of persons with disabilities
content: Stating that the Andhra Pradesh government provides a pension of ₹6,000 to persons with disabilities, disability rights activist Smitha Sadasivan said that as living costs increase, PwDs require more support

title: Employees entitled to 42-day special casual leave for organ donation: Centre
content: Irrespective of the type of surgery for removal of a donor's organ, the duration of special casual leave will be a maximum of 42 days

title: India's geology best in the world, Indian entrepreneurship second to none: Agarwal
content: Unlocking India’s vast natural resources through entrepreneurship is key to securing the country’s future and global leadership

title: ‘400 acre Kancha Gachibowli land was not shown as Forest in Revenue or Forest records’
content: ₹50,000 crore investments are estimated when the 400 acres land is fully occupied and operational, as per a note

title: Party MPs will vote against Waqf Amendment Bill: CPI(M)
content: CPI(M) opposes Waqf Amendment Bill, vows to vote against it in Parliament amid protests from Catholic Church

title: “When a person is starving, does he go to a library?” Supreme Court disposes of plea for libraries in villages
content: Supreme Court observes basic infrastructure such as hygiene, education and healthcare are more important in rural India

title: T.N. CM Stalin writes to PM Modi urging complete withdrawal of Waqf (Amendment) Bill
content: The proposed amendments to the Waqf Act, 1995, have not taken into consideration the constitutional protection given to minorities and are bound to severely harm the interests of the Muslim community, he said

title: Kunal Kamra case: Navi Mumbai banker who attended the show summoned as witness; comedian apologises
content: Before sending him a notice, the investigating officer had called the banker and asked him to visit the Khar police station

title: PM Modi’s visit a great opportunity for India and Sri Lanka: Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath
content: Ahead of PM Modi’s scheduled visit to Sri Lanka from April 4 to 6, 2025, Sri Lanka’s Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath spoke to The Hindu in Colombo on April 1, 2025, on key agreements to be signed, the ‘change’ in India’s engagement with Sri Lanka and more

title: Nilgiris bandh: Shops shut in protest against e-pass system ordered by Madras High Court
content: Many tourists faced difficulties as most restaurants were closed, with many people thronging the Amma Unavagam near the Ooty bus stand to get their meals.

title: Local cuisine to be available in more trains, says Railway Minister Vaishnaw
content: “Whichever train is passing through one particular region, railways is now trying to get the delightful experience of that cuisine for the passengers”

title: Manipur’s demography was changed systematically over decades, says former CM
content: Nongthombam Biren Singh cited official records showing more than 1,500 families from Burma were settled in the State by the 1970s

title: T.N. Assembly unanimously adopts resolution on Katchatheevu retrieval from Sri Lanka
content: During the tenure of former Chief Minister Jayalalithaa, resolutions were passed in the Assembly on October 3, 1991, and May 3, 2013, urging the Union government to reclaim Katchatheevu. When O. Panneerselvam was Chief Minister, a resolution was passed on December 5, 2014

title: BJP seeks apology from Speaker for suspending 18 MLAs for six months in Karnataka
content: BJP claims that, as per an SC order in 2022, the Assembly can suspend MLAs for a limited period necessary to restore order in the House, but not for six months

title: Contentious Waqf (Amendment) Bill tabled in Lok Sabha
content: The bill seeks to improve the administration of Waqf properties, introduce technology-driven management, address complexities and ensure transparency

title: High Court grants bail to more PFI accused in RSS leader murder case
content: Ten activists were granted bail in the case relating to the murder of RSS leader Srinivasan in Palakkad

title: Territorial battles between villages in Manipur and Nagaland flare up
content: The Liangmai community said an extremist group has been backing acts of aggression by people from areas inhabited by two other Naga communities

title: Food Safety Dept. officials seal Chennai restaurant for serving stale food to customers
content: Six people suffered from food poisoning, allegedly after eating at Hotel Bilal Biryani on Triplicane High Road

title: Waqf Bill won't benefit Muslims, says senior AIMPLB official
content: Muslim leaders express concerns over Waqf Bill amendments, urging MPs to reject the proposed changes for community’s benefit

title: Walayar case: Kerala High Court restraint on taking coercive steps against parents of minor girls
content: The court passed the interim order on two petitions filed by the parents challenging the charge sheet filed by the CBI arraigning them as accused in the case

title: Donald Trump’s ‘liberation day’ tariffs: India’s agriculture, machinery, pharma, electrical, chemical sectors may see impact, say experts
content: According to think tank Global Trade Research Initiative, the hardest-hit sector in agriculture would be fish, meat, and processed seafood, with $2.58 billion in exports in 2024, facing a 27.83% tariff differential

title: Police arrest prime accused in Pathar Pratima blast
content: The prime accused, Chandrakanta Banik, is the owner of the firecrackers manufacturing unit situated a few metres away from the house where the explosion took place late Monday night

title: CJI Sanjiv Khanna welcomes Irish Supreme Court Judge Justice Gerard Hogan
content: Justice Gerard Hogan was with the Court of Appeals and was also the Advocate General for the European Court of Appeals, the CJI said

title: Law and order plays key role in overall development of State: Karnataka CM
content: Twenty-two personnel from the Karnataka State Intelligence and Anti-Naxal Force awarded CM’s medal for making the State ‘Naxal free’ in 2024

title: Missing journalist's charred body found in North Andaman, 4 arrested
content: Journalist Shahdeb Dey found murdered in Andaman field, suspects arrested, motive under investigation, forensic report awaited

title: INS Tarkash seizes 2500 kg of narcotics in Western Indian Ocean
content: “On March 31, 2025, while on patrol, INS Tarkash received multiple inputs from Indian Navy P8I maritime patrol aircraft regarding suspicious vessels operating in the area believed to be involved in illicit activities, including narcotics trafficking,” the Defence Ministry said

title: Gujarat firecracker blast: Bodies of deceased taken to villages in Madhya Pradesh
content: “The deceased, which included five children, hailed from the two villages of Sandalpur and Hadia in Dewas and Harda districts of Madhya Pradesh,” officials said

title: Government loses ₹1,757 crore as BSNL fails to bill Reliance Jio for sharing infra: CAG
content: “BSNL failed to enforce the Master Service Agreement (MSA) with M/s. Reliance Jio Infocomm Ltd (RJIL) and did not bill for the additional technology used on BSNL’s shared passive infrastructure, resulting in loss of Rs 1,757.76 crore and penal interest thereon, between May 2014 to March 2024 to the government exchequer,” CAG said

title: Bihar govt’s reply to frequent bridge collapses is a ‘voluminous’ litany of its popular schemes, policies, says SC
content: The counsel for the State said over 10,000 bridges were constructed, however, petitioner-advocate Brajesh Singh said “the State was only intent on constructing bridges without any mechanism to examine them”.

title: Police arrest owner of firecracker godown where blast killed 21 persons in Gujarat’s Banaskantha district
content: “Deepak Mohnani was arrested by a team of Banaskantha police from neighbouring Sabarkantha district on April 1,” Inspector General of Border Range Chirag Koradia said.

title: Kuki groups set up three pre-conditions ahead of April 5 talks in Delhi
content: Kuki-Zo and Meitei groups set pre-conditions ahead of the talks called by the Ministry of Home Affairs in New Delhi on April 5, 2025

title: Indian Army asks Pakistan to abide by 2021 ceasefire agreement after Poonch skirmish
content: The Indian Army reiterated its commitment to maintaining peace along the LoC and emphasized the importance of adhering to the agreement established in 2021

title: Two women Maoists killed in encounter in Madhya Pradesh's Mandla district
content: An SLR rifle, an ordinary rifle, wireless set and some items of daily use were recovered from the spot

title: T.N. CM Stalin seeks urgent meeting with PM Modi over concerns on proposed delimitation
content: “I have requested a meeting with you (Mr. Modi), alongside MPs from various parties, to present our memorandum on the concerns surrounding the proposed delimitation,” Mr. Stalin said

title: Ex-Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel one of the alleged 'beneficiaries' of Mahadev betting scam: CBI FIR
content: The CBI has re-registered the FIR of the Economic Offences Wing (EOW) of the Chhattisgarh police as its own case under the Indian Penal Code sections of 120-B (criminal conspiracy), cheating (420) and Chhattisgarh Gambling (Prohibition) Act

title: More precise weather forecasting system for fishery sector needed, says IMD DG Mrutyunjay Mohapatra
content: IMD has created a WhatsApp group connecting at least five villagers from each village directly with IMD and is ensuring deeper penetration of agrometeorological services, he says

title: Waqf (Amendment) Bill | Analysis and explainers from The Hindu
content: The amendment seeks to reform the 1995 Waqf Act by enhancing the Centre’s regulatory authority over waqf properties

title: Green future for whom?: Revisiting the marginalised lives of Challakere and Pavagada
content: While clean energy is inevitable for a sustainable future, what shouldn’t be ignored is the unequal distribution of burdens of climate action on the poor and marginalised of rural India, argues Bhargavi S. Rao, educator, researcher and former trustee at Environment Support Group

title: Why India needs to clean its air
content: India’s clean air future will be shaped not by dashboards but by people, partnerships, and purpose. Lasting solutions depend on those working on the ground: municipal officers, planners, engineers, and community leaders

title: Now, Vaiko demands ban on Mohanlal-starrer L2: Empuraan
content: Pointing to some controversial scenes depicted in the movie, the Rajya Sabha member says the movie had portrayed Mullaperiyar dam as unsafe

title: Among Ministries, Home Affairs ‘dropped’ most assurances made in Parliament
content: Dropped assurances in Parliament involved issues related to the Pulwama terror attack and the rewarding of policemen allegedly involved in fake encounters

title: Union Shipping Minister says Coastal Shipping Bill will unlock India’s maritime potential
content: Opposition members question the Bill’s impact on fishermen and the role of States in coastal shipping governance

title: BMTC achieves record 39.8% ticket revenue through UPI
content: On February 8, BMTC achieved a significant milestone as the digital payment (UPI) for tickets crossed ₹1 crore in a single day.

title: AIMPLB appeals to secular parties, MPs to oppose Waqf bill, vote against it
content: The AIMPLB president further said in his appeal that these amendments would lead to the abolition of Waqf by-user, removal of exemptions from the Law of Limitation, inclusion of non-Muslim members in Waqf boards and the Central Waqf Council, and the reduction of powers of Waqf tribunals

title: 10th class public examinations conclude peacefully
content: In a statement, Director of School Education V. Vijay Rama Raju said out of 6,24,742 students registered for the Social Studies examination across the State, 6,17,333 students appeared, while 7,409 were absent

title: Karnataka HC refuses to interfere with Bengaluru metro fare hike; says issue belong to domain of experts and not courts
content: The petitioners had contended that fare structure is irrational, as it does not adhere to the station-to-station model, and violates Section 33 of Metro Rail (Operation and Maintenance), Act, 2002.

title: Reduced toll charges between Hyderabad and Vijayawada
content: The revised toll charges, as per the authority, were reduced by ₹15 for a one-way ride and ₹30 for a two-way ride for a light motor vehicle or a four-wheeler at Pantangi toll plaza

title: Panel to ensure smooth implementation of free education for poor children in private schools
content: A State-level committee will determine ‘per-child’ expenditure to be met by the government for students admitted to private schools under the Right of Children to Free and Compulsory Education Act, 2009.

title: TMC leaders question party’s ‘silence’ on SFI’s protests against Mamata at Oxford
content: While some Trinamool leaders have alleged a lack of initiative by party workers and youth members to protest against the SFI’s disruption at Oxford, party MP Sougata Roy said such incidents do not warrant a ‘hue and cry’

title: INSV Tarini reaches Cape Town on final stopover of global circumnavigation
content: The sailing vessel, crewed by two women naval officers, reaches its final international port of call in South Africa during the Navika Sagar Parikrama II circumnavigation.

title: Babulal Marandi demands action against liquor agencies in Jharkhand
content: Former CM alleges that liquor agencies are responsible for revenue loss of over ₹25 crore to the State exchequer as it did not deposit the amount of sales in the shop with Jharkhand State Beverages Corporation Limited (JSBCL)

title: In a first, women in J&K get free bus service
content: J&K CM flags off new travel initiative for women; the free service is limited to smart city e-buses and J&K Road Transport Corporation (JKRTC) buses across the Union Territory

title: Telangana HC to hear two PIL pleas questioning UoH’s Kancha Gachibowli land allotment to TGIIC
content: The counsel informed the Bench that the government’s actions were disturbing the eco-system resulting in harm to the flora and fauna in Kancha Gachibowli

title: Kumbakonam betel leaves, a blend of tradition and tenderness
content: The Kumbakonam betel leaf, which is renowned for its remarkable tenderness (Kozhundhu Vettrilai), owing to its early harvest, has secured the Geographical Indication (GI) tag

title: Bucks catch fire, shoot highest FG% this century
content: The Bucks snapped a four-game skid by shooting 68.9% from the field Tuesday night against the Suns, the highest single-game percentage by any team this century.

title: Campbell reunites with Cards for 18th NFL season
content: Six-time Pro-Bowl defensive lineman Calais Campbell has finalized a one-year deal to return to the Arizona Cardinals for his 18th NFL season, the team announced.

title: Stanton won't blame ailing elbows on torpedo bats
content: Yankees slugger Giancarlo Stanton declined Tuesday to say whether he believes using the torpedo bats last season caused the elbow ailments that have sidelined him this season.

title: Wolves spoil Jokic's 61-point triple-double in 2OT
content: The Timberwolves overcame a career- and NBA-best 61-point triple-double performance from Nikola Jokic to outlast the Nuggets 140-139 in double overtime on Tuesday night.

title: Dodgers' 7-0 start ties 1933 Yanks as May returns
content: With Dustin May on the mound for the first time in more than 22 months, the Dodgers came from behind to beat the Braves 3-1 on Tuesday night and improve to 7-0, tying the 1933 Yankees for the best start to a season by a reigning World Series champion.

title: Roy: Duclair 'god-awful' during Isles' 4-1 loss
content: In the heat of the Eastern Conference playoff race, and with his team struggling, New York Islanders coach Patrick Roy said Anthony Duclair was "god-awful" in a loss to the Tampa Bay Lightning, and that the veteran is failing to meet expectations.

title: Curry drops 52 in wild win vs. Grizz: 'Tank is full'
content: Stephen Curry had 52 points and 12 3-pointers as the Warriors held on for a wild 134-125 win over the Grizzlies on Tuesday night.

title: Study: MLB average salary tops $5M for 1st time
content: Major League Baseball's average salary broke the $5 million mark on Opening Day for the first time, according to a study by The Associated Press.

title: MLB Rank 2025: Ranking baseball's top 100 players
content: From top sluggers like Ohtani and Judge to star pitchers like Skenes, we rank -- and make predictions for -- the best players in baseball right now.

title: Where will Aaron Rodgers sign? Here's everything we learned at the 2025 NFL owners meetings
content: Pittsburgh executives are feeling good about their chances with Rodgers, but could Minnesota still be in play?

title: League meetings: QB options, draft maneuvers, roster holes
content: Annual meetings wrapped up Tuesday, and more than 20 of our reporters on the ground had all the news.

title: Why Ovechkin is 'nearly impossible' to stop: Opponents, teammates explain his shot
content: Top NHL blueliners, goalies and scorers explain Ovi's unique skill as he closes in on Wayne Gretzky's record.

title: Geno, Lobo and the team that changed women's basketball: An oral history of 1994-95 UConn
content: As the Huskies compete for their 12th national title, it's time to look back at their first, 30 years ago this week.

title: Bilas: Why this men's Final Four will be 'absolutely incredible'
content: No low seeds? No problem. We get to watch ten of the most efficient teams of all time match up -- and that's a good thing.

title: Men's Final Four predictions, previews for Auburn-Florida, Duke-Houston
content: Here's how each 1-seed reached San Antonio and their key to reaching the final, plus disagreement on one game.

title: Cade Cunningham isn't satisfied yet: 'I think I can be the best basketball player in the world'
content: The former No. 1 pick has led Detroit's resurgence, but he has loftier goals than just ending the Pistons' five-year playoff drought.

title: USWNT Big Board: How the 2027 World Cup team is taking shape
content: USWNT coach Emma Hayes has made it clear she's shaking up the U.S. roster for the 2027 Women's World Cup. Let's look at how that's going.

title: Inside one prospect's 'storybook' journey from Egypt to the NFL draft
content: Despite initial language barriers and a lack of football knowledge, Ahmed Hassanein is close to becoming the first Egyptian to be drafted in the NFL.

title: Power schools will outsource enforcing NIL payments to athletes
content: Skeptics say cash to players for commercial endorsements often far exceeds the service's actual value.

title: NHL playoff watch: Are the Rangers and Wild both on the ropes?
content: The teams are struggling to clinch as they match up Wednesday. Plus, bracket projections after a busy Tuesday.﻿

title: Women's Final Four predictions: A unanimous favorite and a split decision
content: No. 1 seeds UCLA, South Carolina and Texas are bound for Tampa, as well as 2-seed UConn. Who will reach the title game?

title: Reranking the women's Final Four: First look at the national semifinals
content: No. 1 seeds UCLA, South Carolina and Texas advanced to the Final Four. But 2-seed UConn tops our list.

title: Inside the Grizzlies' shocking firing of Taylor Jenkins
content: The Grizzlies believe this firing will help reconnect the team's tantalizing core -- and reignite Ja Morant. But in truth, this dismissal began with five other ones nearly a year ago.

title: Bukayo Saka's return provides a glimmer of hope in Arsenal's injury-riddled season
content: Bukayo Saka made his return for Arsenal after three months, making an instant impact and giving Mikel Arteta's Gunners hope for what lies ahead.

title: Anthony Elanga is proof of how Man United desperately need to improve transfer strategy
content: Man United have seen more players leave and find success than those still at the club now. That must change.

title: What's going on with Rafael Devers? Putting his historic strikeout streak into context
content: Boston's designated hitter has struck out 15 times and has no hits through the first five games. Here's what history tells us about his bad start.

title: 'The whole thing is chaos': The art of the March Madness buzzer-beater
content: How does a buzzer-beater come to be? A little strategy, a lot of luck, and the right player at the right time.

title: USWNT's Shaw 'struggled' with Courage move
content: United States forward Jaedyn Shaw has said she has struggled to deal with expectations since joining North Carolina Courage in January.

title: Maresca coy on Jadon Sancho's Chelsea future
content: Maresca refused to confirm whether the club will take up their obligation to buy Sancho and warned the winger "could do better" with his end product.

title: Madrid's Ancelotti testifies in tax fraud case
content: Real Madrid coach Carlo Ancelotti told a Spanish court on Wednesday he had believed his tax affairs were legal as he testified in a trial in which he is accused of failing to pay €1 million ($1.08m) in tax on image rights revenue.

title: Amorim: I won't get much time to fix Utd woes
content: Ruben Amorim insisted he will not be given much time to turn things around as Manchester United manager, as his team slumped to another defeat at Nottingham Forest on Tuesday.

title: Arteta 'worried' by Arsenal's fresh injury crisis
content: Arsenal face a potential injury crisis in defense ahead of their Champions League showdown with Real Madrid after Gabriel Magalhães and Jurriën Timber picked up injuries in Tuesday's Premier League win over Fulham.

title: Messi fit as Miami eyes 'big step' into semifinals
content: Inter Miami head coach Javier Mascherano recognized the importance of reaching the Concacaf Champions Cup semifinals as a young club, but warned against taking the quarterfinal series against LAFC for granted.

title: Messi's bodyguard no longer on Miami sidelines
content: Lionel Messi's bodyguard Yassine Cheuko said he has been banned from protecting the Argentina forward from the touchline during Inter Miami matches.

title: Kane downplays PL return: 'Happy' at Bayern
content: In an exclusive interview with ESPN, Harry Kane said he is unsure about a Premier League return and said he is already playing at the highest level.

title: Players to watch at the 2025 ANWA: Lottie Woad, Asterisk Talley among top contenders
content: Who are some of the top players to watch at the sixth edition of the Augusta National Women's Amateur.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye $52m move for Delap
content: Is Ipswich's Liam Delap the one to solve Manchester United's goal-scoring woes? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Adrian Peterson, Antonio Gates take center stage in Madden NFL 25 Season 7
content: Another wave of Madden Ultimate Team content has been revealed, with Franchise Heroes coming to the roster.

title: In 10 big numbers - Waqf and its properties in India
content: A heated debate occurred in the Lok Sabha over the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, with Congress criticising it as unconstitutional and BJP defending it as necessary to prevent misuse. The Bill focuses on stricter criteria for Waqf declarations and amendments meant to enhance regulation and prevent illegal occupancy and misuse of Waqf lands, which are significant in India.

title: Waqf Amendment Bill: Why Muslims are opposing it
content: Muslim leaders and organizations object to the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, asserting it threatens the autonomy of Waqf properties dedicated for religious and charitable purposes. They claim the Bill aims to seize such lands and hampers Muslim religious liberties, labeling it as deceptive and unconstitutional.

title: 'Rishabh Pant has been a big shock, LSG have to ... '
content: Rishabh Pant's lackluster performance both as a batsman and captain is putting Lucknow Super Giants under scrutiny in IPL 2025, following two losses in three matches. Former cricketer Harbhajan Singh suggests that LSG urgently find a solution to bolster their chances and address Pant's struggle. LSG were restricted to 171/7, thanks to Arshdeep Singh's three-wicket burst, and their bowlers failed to stop Punjab Kings batters during the chase. Punjab Kings reached the target with ease in just 16.2 overs.

title: Why Wisconsin Supreme Court loss was personal for Elon Musk
content: Elon Musk’s involvement in this race was far from incidental. As a key figure in President Donald Trump’s administration and leader of the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), Musk has become increasingly active in shaping political outcomes. DOGE has drawn significant attention for its aggressive cost-cutting measures across federal agencies, making Musk a polarizing figure in American politics.

title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella to employees: Best thing about China's Deepseek is …
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella praised China-based AI company DeepSeek for its innovation and impact, highlighting its efficient optimization with a small team. This sets a new standard for Microsoft's AI development, emphasizing the importance of focused collaboration and rapid technological advancement.

title: Lalu Yadav discharged from Bihar Hosp, to head to AIIMS Delhi as health declines
content: RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav was discharged from Paras Hospital in Bihar and will now head to AIIMS Delhi for further treatment. His son, Tejaswi Yadav, confirmed that Lalu's current health is stable but his blood pressure and sugar levels have been fluctuating. Party leader Bhai Virendra assured that there's no need to worry.

title: Let my team sleep please: OpenAI CEO to users making Ghibli style images
content: OpenAI's Sam Altman has requested users to reduce the generation of Ghibli-style images, stressing the strain on his team. Other AI platforms such as Google's Gemini and Grok can also produce similar visuals, though the output might vary. Free options like Craiyon and DeepAI offer alternative solutions.

title: Suryakumar Yadav set to follow Yashasvi from Mumbai to Goa?
content: A coup is seemingly underway in Mumbai cricket as Yashasvi Jaiswal seeks a No Objection Certificate and Suryakumar Yadav may follow him to Goa. The Goa Cricket Association is in talks with various players as they join the Ranji Trophy Elite Group. Discussions involve Hyderabad captain Tilak Varma too. Mumbai Cricket Association is holding meetings about these developments.

title: Watch: Rinku brutally trolled for asking Rohit Sharma's bat
content: After an IPL clash against Mumbai Indians, Rinku Singh humorously asked for a bat from Rohit Sharma. Tilak Varma teased him for this. Rinku has previously requested bats from Virat Kohli and Suryakumar Yadav. MI defeated KKR by eight wickets with a strong performance. Rinku’s interactions added a lighthearted moment to the game.

title: Donald Trump says he will consider a final proposal for TikTok sale as…
content: US President Donald Trump is set to make a final decision on TikTok on April 2. The proposal involves potential investors like Blackstone and Oracle, to address security concerns. Trump set an April 5 deadline for TikTok's parent company ByteDance to sell its stake or face a ban. The deal hinges on approval from Beijing.

title: 'Game changer': UFC Boss Dana White announces partnership with Meta
content: UFC has announced a major multi-year partnership with Meta, marking Meta as the UFC's first-ever Official Fan Technology Partner. This collaboration aims to integrate AI, virtual reality, and social media to enhance fan interaction and create innovative content and experiences for UFC fans.

title: Trump candidates win 2 by-polls but Dems clawing back
content: Republican candidates won two by-elections in Florida, but a Trump and Musk-backed judge lost in the Wisconsin Supreme Court race. The Florida wins give Republicans a slight edge in the House, though with narrower margins. In Wisconsin, liberal Judge Susan Crawford's victory maintains a liberal majority, countering Musk's significant campaign efforts.

title: Hyderabad University: Police resort to lathi charge as students, faculty protest
content: Police carried out a lathi charge on University of Hyderabad students and faculty protesting the government's decision to auction 400-acre land. Students and teachers demanded transparency in land-related documents and the removal of police and excavators, alleging betrayal by the varsity administration.

title: Rohit Sharma breaks silence: 'I was the captain, now I’m not'
content: Rohit Sharma discusses his evolved role within Mumbai Indians from middle-order batter and captain to opening batsman. Despite changes, his focus remains on winning games and trophies for MI. He highlighted the inclusion of new players like Trent Boult and Mitchell Santner bringing experience, aiming to win the IPL trophy.

title: 'Will harm interests of Muslims': MK Stalin writes letter to PM Modi on Waqf Bill
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to withdraw the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2024, stating that the amendments might harm the Muslim community's interests. Stalin argued the existing Waqf Act is sufficient and changes would weaken Waqf Boards and could affect religious autonomy and historical properties.

title: Samir Arora warns! Biggest risk to Indian markets not Trump’s tariffs but…
content: Samir Arora of Helios Capital suggests that the Indian stock market faces greater risk from a potential US economic downturn prompted by Trump's tariffs rather than direct tariffs on India. Arora underscores how US market instability could affect various sectors, including Indian IT, and investor trends.

title: Musk’s cheesehead moment in Wisconsin rally gets reaction from Brett Favre
content: Billionaire Elon Musk made waves at a Wisconsin rally by wearing a Cheesehead, honoring the state's dairy farmers and Green Bay Packers fans. The event was notable for Musk’s controversial $1 million checks to voters, sparking legal scrutiny. Green Bay Packers legend Brett Favre humorously acknowledged Musk's gesture. Musk's presence emphasized his growing influence in political spheres.

title: 'Badnaam hue to kia hua': Pastor converted to Christianity during jail term
content: Self-styled preacher Bajinder Singh, originally convicted for murder and later converted to Christianity, has been sentenced to life imprisonment by a Punjab court for a 2018 rape case. Known for his claims of miraculous healing, Singh's ministry faced scrutiny after a 22-year-old woman accused him of sexual harassment, stalking, and criminal intimidation, leading to widespread controversy.

title: Aishwarya and Aaradhya Bachchan set stylish mother-daughter fashion goals
content: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Abhishek Bachchan dismissed recent rumors with their appearance at a family wedding, where Aishwarya and their daughter Aaradhya's twinning outfits stole the show. The couple's Bollywood magic was highlighted by a 'Kajra Re' dance performance with Aaradhya. On the work front, Aishwarya and Abhishek have exciting upcoming projects.

title: Mahatma Gandhi's great-granddaughter, Nilamben Parikh, dies at 92
content: Nilamben Parikh, Mahatma Gandhi's great-granddaughter, passed away peacefully at 92. Known for her dedication to tribal women through her organisation Dakshinapatha, she followed Gandhian principles throughout her life. Parikh was also an author, writing about the complex relationship between Gandhi and his son Harilal. Her passing marks a significant loss to Indian history.

title: 'Let them play freely': 1983 World Cup winner to Goenka on Pant chats
content: 1983 World Cup winner Madan Lal urged for less pressure on cricketers following LSG owner Sanjiv Goenka's conversation with Rishabh Pant after their IPL 2025 defeat to PBKS. This incident follows a confrontation with KL Rahul last year. Pant admitted his team was short of 25 runs on the track.

title: Delhi horror: After being pestered over TV remote, drunk man kills friend’s daughter
content: In Swaroop Nagar, Delhi, a man was arrested for allegedly killing his friend's seven-year-old daughter. The intoxicated suspect assaulted the girl when she repeatedly asked for the TV remote. He then strangled her to prevent her from revealing the incident. Parents are advised to avoid leaving young children unattended and to install security measures.

title: Earthquake hits Myanmar: Isro reveals before and after satellite images
content: The devastating 7.7-magnitude earthquake on March 28, 2025, left thousands dead and massive destruction in Myanmar, particularly hitting Mandalay hard. High-resolution satellite images from ISRO showcased key damaged areas, aiding in relief efforts. International aid, including from India, is supporting rescue and recovery operations as the nation works to rebuild.

title: TN CM Stalin writes to PM Modi seeking appointment on delimitation issue
content: Chief Minister M K Stalin requested a meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi to present a memorandum on delimitation from recent Joint Action Committee discussions. Stalin emphasized the significance of fair representation for citizens in parliamentary democracy and sought an audience along with select MPs from different parties to formally submit the concerns.

title: How self-styled spiritual leaders threaten law and order
content: Various spiritual leaders have been embroiled in significant controversies leading to legal actions and imprisonment. Notable cases include Bajinder Singh convicted for sexual assault, Rampal sentenced to life imprisonment, Gurmeet Ram Rahim serving for rape and murder, and Jalebi Baba found guilty of raping and blackmailing over 100 women.

title: Government appoints economist Poonam Gupta as RBI Deputy Governor
content: Poonam Gupta, Director General of NCAER, has been appointed as Deputy Governor of the RBI for a three-year term. The position was vacant since January after M.D. Patra's tenure ended. Gupta brings extensive experience in economic policy, having worked at the IMF and World Bank, and holding academic roles at prestigious institutions.

title: 'Anti-semitism': Princeton becomes latest university to face US funding halt
content: The US government recently suspended multiple research grants at Princeton University from agencies like the Department of Energy, Nasa, and the Defence Department. The suspension is amidst investigations into anti-semitism at Princeton. The university is one of many facing federal scrutiny over these issues. Princeton assures cooperation and defence of academic freedom.

title: From Maruti to Mahindra, prices see hike starting April 1: Find out new prices
content: Car manufacturers in India have increased prices due to rising input costs and inflation. Maruti Suzuki leads with up to a 4% hike. Other brands like Tata Motors, Mahindra, and Hyundai have also raised prices up to 3%. Despite this, dealers are offering discounts on entry-level models to boost sales in a challenging market.

title: Waqf Bill to be named UMEED: Kiren Rijiju in LS
content: The BJP-led central government tabled the Waqf (Amendment) Bill in Parliament amid opposition from the INDIA bloc, incorporating suggestions from the Joint Parliamentary Committee. Union minister Kiren Rijiju defended the reforms, citing extensive consultations and emphasizing no interference in religious institutions, while Congress accused the Centre of rushing the legislation.

title: Delhi court rejects Medha Patkar's appeal against conviction in defamation case
content: A Delhi Court dismissed Medha Patkar's appeal against her 2001 defamation conviction. The court upheld the sentencing of five months imprisonment and a Rs. 10 lakh fine for defaming V K Saxena. Patkar is required to appear in person for sentencing on April 8.

title: Sanju Samson cleared by CoE to keep wickets; set to return as RR captain
content: Rajasthan Royals captain Sanju Samson is set to resume his wicketkeeping and captaincy roles after being cleared by the BCCI's Centre of Excellence. Previously limited to batting due to a fractured finger, Samson will lead the team in their next match against Punjab Kings on April 5.

title: "Can't Donate Someone Else's Property," Says Amit Shah On Waqf Bill
content: Union minister Amit Shah, speaking at the debate over the Waqf Amendment Bill in Lok Sabha this evening, presented a long list of properties that he said were given for Waqf.

title: High Court Halts All Work On Disputed Land Near Hyderabad University
content: The Telangana High Court on Wednesday halted - for 24 hours - work on 400 acres of land in Kancha Gachibowli, which is at the centre of a row after students protesting against redevelopment clashed with cops.

title: Kiren Rijiju Blasts UPA Government: "Parliament Was Being Claimed As Waqf"
content: The promised eight-hour debate Wednesday on the Waqf Amendment Bill began with a point of order raised by an opposition MP - NK Ramachandran of the Revolutionary Socialist Party - who questioned the authority of the JPC that scrutinised the bill.

title: "Today's Morality Different": Top Court On Rape Cases After Marriage Promise
content: A failed romantic relationship need not always mean sexual relations were forced on either party, the Supreme Court noted Wednesday as it heard a plea by a man to quash rape charges levelled by his former betrothed.

title: Akhilesh Yadav Jabs BJP Over Delay In Choosing Chief, Amit Shah Replies
content: The Lok Sabha today witnessed a banter between Union Home Minister Amit Shah and Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav after the latter fired a barb at the ruling BJP for its delay in electing a party president.

title: "Dilute, Defame, Divide, Disenfranchise": Congress' '4D' Attack On Waqf Bill
content: Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi launched a fierce counterattack Wednesday - after Minority Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju tabled the Waqf Amendment Bill - accusing the BJP-led government of trying to "defame (and) disenfranchise minorities" and staging an "a

title: Who Is Poonam Gupta? All About New RBI Deputy Governor
content: Poonam Gupta's appointment as RBI Deputy Governor comes ahead of the crucial Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) meeting scheduled for April 7-9, 2025.

title: How US Teacher Accused Of Raping Student Reacted To Charges Against Her
content: Christina Formella, a teacher at Downers Grove South High School, looked shocked when police stopped her car on March 16 and asked her to "grab whatever she needed."

title: Argument After Delhi Metro Commuter Refuses To Give Up Seat, Internet Reacts
content: A video has surfaced showing a heated argument between a man and a group of women in a crowded Delhi Metro on the Blue Line near Janakpuri West.

title: IPL 2025 Live: Virat Kohli On Brink Of Historic Feat As RCB Take On GT
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru vs Gujarat Titans LIVE Cricket Score, IPL 2025: Royal Challengers Bengaluru are eyeing their third win on trot in the IPL 2025 as they take on Gujarat Titans on Wednesday.

title: LSG Owner Sanjiv Goenka Catches Rishabh Pant, Recreates KL Rahul Scene
content: Rishabh Pant was involved in an intense chat with LSG owner Sanjiv Goenka after the team's defeat against Punjab Kings.

title: Arnold Schwarzenegger To Jerry Seinfeld, New Billionaires In Forbes List
content: Hollywood actor Arnold Schwarzenegger and comedian Jerry Seinfeld have earned a spot in the Forbes' Billionaires List 2025.

title: 'Can’t be a dumping ground’: Now, Calcutta HC lawyers protest Delhi judge transfer
content: Three lawyers' bodies of Calcutta HC decided to boycott the swearing-in of Justice Dinesh Kumar Sharma, protesting his transfer from Delhi HC. They argued the transfer undermines the court's integrity due to allegations of impropriety against Justice Sharma.

title: After juice vendor, now sanitation worker in UP gets Rs 34 crore I-T notice
content: A sanitation worker in Aligarh, UP, earning Rs 15,000 monthly, received an income tax notice for Rs 34 crore, suggesting his PAN card was misused. Karan Kumar, who learned of the notice on March 29, filed a police complaint. I-T officials plan to investigate the misuse cases through faceless assessments.

title: Yashasvi Jaiswal to move to Goa from Mumbai
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal, India’s Test opener, is making a significant shift from Mumbai to Goa for the 2025-26 season, where he will serve as captain. Despite his deep roots in Mumbai cricket, Jaiswal seeks a No-Objection Certificate to officially make the move.

title: Unprecedented CCP shake-up: Xi’s inner circle gets a jolt
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping has unexpectedly swapped roles of Politburo members Li Ganjie and Shi Taifeng. This significant move, seen as part of Xi’s strategy to consolidate power ahead of the 2027 party congress, puts Li in charge of the United Front Work Department and Shi the Organisation Department, signaling Xi’s ongoing drive to eliminate rivals and reinforce loyalty.

title: Rabada EXCLUSIVE: 'Even a No. 10 can hit a six... there's no real mystery'
content: Nicholas Pooran is leading with an impressive strike rate and six count, making IPL 2024 a high-scoring season. Kagiso Rabada discusses the challenges for bowlers, the Impact Player rule, and shares his experience with coach Ashish Nehra and the upcoming WTC final.

title: Israel to seize 'large areas' of Gaza, military vows to 'crush and clean terrorists'
content: Israel is intensifying its military operations in Gaza to reclaim significant areas and enhance security zones. This comes in response to ongoing conflict with Hamas. Israeli defence minister Katz emphasized the objective of eliminating terrorist threats and stressed the evacuation of civilians from affected regions.

title: Forbes 2025: How Donald Trump Doubled His Net Worth In A Year
content: Donald Trump first appeared on the inaugural Forbes 400 list in 1982 alongside his father with a combined estimated fortune of $200 million

title: Opinion: Trump & The Ayatollah: It's a Pity Both Can't Lose
content: Who can predict the outcome of a tryst between a self-styled "transactional" deal-maker and those who coined the word "Bazaar" and raised negotiations to the art of 'Mutazayedat', or overbidding?

title: Barça wrong to register Olmo, Víctor - LaLiga
content: laLiga say they have never had the salary space to register Dani Olmo or Pau Vctor . the league has questioned the €100 million deal which led to the CSD granting the duo temporary registrations . they will report the unnamed auditor barça used to verify the sale of VIP seats at Spotify Camp Nou .

title: 2025 rankings: Profiles for the top 55 WRs
content: Mike Clay reveals his fantasy football rookie rankings at each key offensive position . the 2025 rankings do not include rookies, since we are unsure of their landing spot . he has finished in the top 12 in fantasy PPG in all four of his seasons .

title: NBA coaching carousel: What's next for the Grizzlies and Kings jobs?
content: the Memphis Grizzlies fired longtime coach Taylor Jenkins on friday . there are two open head coaching jobs with two weeks to go in the regular season . this year's coaching carousel looks at the pros and cons of each vacancy .

title: NBA Power Rankings: What to watch for all 30 teams as season's end nears
content: teams are snapping up postseason spots but the race to avoid the play-in tournament is changing by the day . at the bottom end of the standings, several teams are straddling the fine line between a strong finish and improving their lottery chances for the no. 1 draft pick .

title: Meet The Wealthy People Who Dropped Off Forbes Billionaire List This Year
content: the 2025 Forbes Billionaire List saw 107 individuals lose their billionaire status, slipping below the threshold required to remain on the prestigious list . Lisa Su, the CEO of Advanced Micro Devices, led one of the most remarkable turnarounds in the tech world . as of 2024, she was among just 26 self-made women and 2 others .

title: Yashasvi Jaiswal Quits Mumbai, Submits Application To Change Team: Report
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal has reportedly decided to quit the team and join Goa from the next season onwards . he is said to have written an email to the Mumbai Cricket Association seeking a No Objection Certificate to change his cricket state team .
